info.description:
**Please note that, for the beta version, we will try to avoid any breaking changes as much as possible, but we will not guarantee it.**

**Client applications using the beta version should expect breaking changes from time to time**

Our APIs let your applications fetch data from Croesus, allowing you to manage Croesus information and functions in your applications..

Based on simple REST principles, our API endpoints return metadata in JSON format.
info.title: Croesus Services - Preview

parameters.name: requestedCurrency
parameters.description:
The information requested will be converted to this currency. 

The list of supported currencies follow the International Standard for currency codes (ISO 4217).

The values must be provided in upper case.

If not provided, the account will be returned using its own currency.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
Field name that will be used to sort. 

The supported target fields are:

- LongName

- ShortName

- Number (default; ascending)

- InvestmentAdvisorCode

- AccountCurrency

- TotalValue

- Margin

- Balance

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A valid access token.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the Croesus IDs for the accounts.

parameters.description:
The information requested will be converted to this currency.

The values must be provided in upper case.

If not provided, each account will be returned using their own currency.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
Field name that will be used to sort.

The supported target fields are:

- LongName

- Number (default; ascending)

- Balance

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
Cursor that points to the start of the page of data that has been returned.

If neither the before nor the after is specified, the first page will be returned.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
Cursor that points to the end of the page of data that has been returned.

If neither the before nor the after is specified, the first page will be returned.

parameters.name: pageLimit
parameters.description: Number of elements to return, for the current page. Fewer elements may be returned if it is the last page.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A valid access token.

get.summary: Get the blended portfolio for a list of clients.

parameters.name: requestedCurrency
parameters.description:
The information requested will be converted to this currency. The list of supported currencies follow the International Standard for currency codes (ISO 4217).

The values must be provided in upper case.

If not provided:

- If all clients have the same currency, the portfolio will be calculated using the client currency.

- Otherwise, the portfolio will be calculated using the firm currency.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
The mode wanted. If the mode parameter has the value "assetClass" the portfolio will be displayed in the "By Asset Class" mode.


Otherwise the "By Security" mode is used.

parameters.name: includeZeroPositions
parameters.description: Determines whether the zero quantity positions held by the portfolio must be included.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A valid access token.

schema.description:
On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 200 OK and the response body contains one of the following object, in JSON format:

* a portfolioBySecurity object (when the parameter "mode" = "security")
* a portfolioByAssetClass object (when the parameter "mode" = "assetClass")

Objects are returned in the order requested. If an object in not found, a null value is returned in the appropriate position.

On error, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the Croesus IDs for the client.

get.summary: Get the portfolio for a list of accounts.

parameters.name: requestedCurrency
parameters.description:
The information requested will be converted to this currency. The list of supported currencies follow the International Standard for currency codes (ISO 4217).

The values must be provided in upper case.

If not provided:

- If all accounts have the same currency, the portfolio will be calculated using the account currency.

- Otherwise, the portfolio will be calculated using the firm currency.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
The mode wanted. If the mode parameter has the value "assetClass" the portfolio will be displayed in the "By Asset Class" mode.


Otherwise the "By Security" mode is used.

parameters.name: includeZeroPositions
parameters.description: Determines whether the zero quantity positions held by the portfolio must be included.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A valid access token.

schema.description:
On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 200 OK and the response body contains one of the following object, in JSON format:

* a portfolioBySecurity object (when the parameter "mode" = "security")
* a portfolioByAssetClass object (when the parameter "mode" = "assetClass")

Objects are returned in the order requested. If an object in not found, a null value is returned in the appropriate position.

On error, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the Croesus IDs for the account

get.summary: Get the portfolio for a list of relationships

parameters.name: requestedCurrency
parameters.description:
The information requested will be converted to this currency. The list of supported currencies follow the International Standard for currency codes (ISO 4217).

The values must be provided in upper case.

If not provided:

- If all relationships have the same currency, the portfolio will be calculated using the relationship currency.

- Otherwise, the portfolio will be calculated using the firm currency.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
The mode wanted. If the mode parameter has the value "assetClass" the portfolio will be displayed in the "By Asset Class" mode.


Otherwise the "By Security" mode is used.

parameters.name: includeZeroPositions
parameters.description: Determines whether the zero quantity positions held by the portfolio must be included.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A valid access token.

schema.description:
On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 200 OK and the response body contains one of the following object, in JSON format:

* a portfolioBySecurity object (when the parameter "mode" = "security")
* a portfolioByAssetClass object (when the parameter "mode" = "assetClass")

Objects are returned in the order requested. If an object in not found, a null value is returned in the appropriate position.

On error, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

Bearer.description: Token obtained by the login endpoint
Bearer.name: Authorization

RequestedCurrency.description:
Currency to convert the amounts into, if different than account currency.

When there is a requested currency, the amounts returned are converted based 
on the requested currency when necessary

Balance.description: Cash balance of the account as at settlement date.

TotalValue.description: Account market value including accrued interest and dividends

LastTransactionDate.description: Date of the last transaction in the account

LastTradeDate.description: Date of the last trade in the account

StartDate.description: Date on which the address becomes valid

EndDate.description: Date on which the address is no longer valid

IsMailingAddress.description: Indicates whether this address is the mailing address

PositionId.description:
Unique Croesus position identifier

Unique per asset class

AccountNumber.description:
Firm account number

Calculation is based on current dividend payment frequency and the amount of the last dividend paid

Primary root, which corresponds to the primary client. Its number is used as the grouping identification number.

Quantity.description:
Position quantity

Weighted average of each position's cost yields

MarketValue.description:
Position market value.

Market value excluding accrued interest and dividends

MarketValuePercentage.description:
Position market value (%).

Position market value as a percentage of total portfolio value

GainLossPercentage.description: Percentage of realized gains and losses for the position

RequestedCurrency.description:
Currency to convert the amounts into, if different than account currency.

When there is a requested currency, the amounts returned are converted based 
on the requested currency when necessary

Balance.description: Cash balance of all of the client accounts as at settlement date

TotalValue.description: Client market value including accrued interest and dividends

LastContactDate.description: Date of the last contact with the client

Addresses.description: List of the client's mailing addresses

Phones.description: List of the client's telephone numbers

Emails.description: List of the client's email addresses

RequestedCurrency.description:
Currency to convert the amounts into, if different than account currency.

When there is a requested currency, the amounts returned are converted based 
on the requested currency when necessary

Balance.description: Cash balance of all of the client accounts as at settlement date

TotalValue.description: Client market value including accrued interest and dividends

LastContactDate.description: Date of the last contact with the client

IsDefaultEmail.description: Indicates whether this email address is the default email address

Status.description: The HTTP status code (also returned in the response header; see Response Status Codes Response Status Codes for more information).

Message.description: A short description of the cause of the error.

Detail.description: A detailed description of the cause of the error. Provides additionnal information.
Detail.example: Bad query parameter [$size]: Invalid integer value [abc]

Error.description: This general error structure is used throughout this API.

PageLimit.description: The maximum number of items in the response (as set in the query or by default).

Next.description:
Id to obtain next page.
Empty if there is no next page (i.e. the current page is the last page).

Previous.description:
Id to obtain previous page.
Empty if there is no previous page (i.e. the current page is the first page).

NumberOfItems.description: The total number of items returned in the current page

Paging.description: This general paging structure is used throughout this API.

Next.description:
Id to obtain next page.
Empty if there is no next page (i.e. the current page is the last page).

Previous.description:
Id to obtain previous page.
Empty if there is no previous page (i.e. the current page is the first page).

NumberOfItems.description: The total number of items returned in the current page

PagingTransaction.description: Paging structure is used to return a list of transactions.

IsReadOnly.description: Indicates whether this phone number is editable

PortfolioAssetAllocationId.description:
Portfolio's asset class identifier.

Unique per asset class

Percentage.description: Ratio of the asset class' market value to the account's market value.

MarketValue.description: Market value is equal to the market price multiplied by the quantity of the position

BookValueACB.description: Average cost per share of a security adjusted to include any further purchases or reinvested dividends.

AnnualIncome.description: Projected interests and dividends accumulated over a one-year period

PositionQty.description: Number of position held in the asset class

AccountCount.description: Number of accounts included in the portfolio

AccruedInterestDividend.description:
Portfolio accrued interest and dividends.

Sum of accrued interest and dividends of each positions held in the portfolio

CumulatedInterestDividend.description:
Portfolio accumulated interest and dividends.

Sum of accumulated interest and dividends of each position held in the portfolio

AnnualIncome.description:
Portfolio annual income estimate.

Calculation is based on current dividend payment frequency and the amount of the last dividend paid

Primary root, which corresponds to the primary client. Its number is used as the grouping identification number.

AverageCostYield.description:
Portfolio average cost yield.

Weighted average of each position's cost yields

MarketValue.description:
Portfolio market value.

Market value excluding accrued interest and dividends

NetInvestment.description:
Portfolio net investment.

Net amount of cash flows as at portfolio date; Inflows - Outflows

PositionQty.description: Number of position held in the portfolio

TotalValue.description:
Portfolio total value.

Total value is equal to market value plus accrued interest and dividends

AccountCount.description: Number of accounts included in the portfolio

AccruedInterestDividend.description:
Portfolio accrued interest and dividends.

Sum of accrued interest and dividends of each positions held in the portfolio

AnnualIncome.description:
Portfolio annual income estimate.

Calculation is based on current dividend payment frequency and the amount of the last dividend paid

Primary root, which corresponds to the primary client. Its number is used as the grouping identification number.

AverageCostYield.description:
Portfolio average cost yield.

Weighted average of each position's cost yields

CumulatedInterestDividend.description:
Portfolio accumulated interest and dividends.

Sum of accumulated interest and dividends of each position held in the portfolio

MarketValue.description:
Portfolio market value.

Market value excluding accrued interest and dividends

NetInvestment.description:
Portfolio net investment.

Net amount of cash flows as at portfolio date; Inflows - Outflows

PositionQty.description: Number of position held in the portfolio

TotalValue.description:
Portfolio total value.

Total value is equal to market value plus accrued interest and dividends

PositionId.description:
Unique Croesus position identifier

Unique per asset class

AccountNumber.description:
Firm account number

Calculation is based on current dividend payment frequency and the amount of the last dividend paid

Primary root, which corresponds to the primary client. Its number is used as the grouping identification number.

Quantity.description:
Position quantity

Weighted average of each position's cost yields

MarketValue.description:
Position market value.

Market value excluding accrued interest and dividends

MarketValuePercentage.description:
Position market value (%).

Position market value as a percentage of total portfolio value

GainLossPercentage.description: Percentage of realized gains and losses for the position

PositionAssetAllocationId.description:
Position's asset class identifier.

Unique per asset class

Percentage.description: Ratio of the asset class' market value to the account's market value.

Value.description: Indicates whether the product is available

PeriodTotal.description: Total projected income for the period.

ExpiredSecuritiesTotal.description: Total projected income for the expired securities

RelationshipRepresentativeId.description: Unique Croesus client identifier that is the primary contact for the relationship

RelationshipRepresentativeNumber.description: Number of the client that is the primary contact for the relationship

RelationshipRepresentativeShortName.description: Short name of the client that is the primary contact for the relationship

RelationshipRepresentativeLongName.description: Long name of the client that is the primary contact for the relationship

RequestedCurrency.description:
Currency in which the information is returned.

Amounts are converted from the relationship currency to the requested currency.

Balance.description: Cash balance of the relationship as at settlement date

TotalValue.description: Relationship market value including accrued interest and dividends

InvestmentObjective.description: Description of the relationship's investment objective

Addresses.description: List of the relationship's mailing addresses

Phones.description: List of the relationship's telephone numbers

Emails.description: List of the relationship's email addresses

RequestedCurrency.description:
Currency in which the information is returned.

Amounts are converted from the relationship currency to the requested currency.

Balance.description: Cash balance of the relationship as at settlement date

TotalValue.description: Relationship market value including accrued interest and dividends

InvestmentObjective.description: Description of the relationship's investment objective

Value.description: Indicates whether the service is available

ClientNumber.description:
Firm client number

Primary root, which corresponds to the primary client. Its number is used as the grouping identification number.

ProcessDate.description: Date on which the transaction was processed

SettlementDate.description: The date by which a security must be paid for or sold

TransactionDate.description: Date on which the transaction was traded

GainsLosses.description: Amount of the gains and losses

PercentGainLoss.description: Percentage of gains and losses for the transaction

Authentication.description:
In order to authenticate using Croesus APIs, a user must first call the oauth2 token API. If successful, this call will return a session token that can be used to call all other APIs. To do so, the header "Authorization" must be used but this time with the token scheme followed by the session token obtained in the previous call.

Although tokens can be sent as URL query-string parameters, this practice is not recommended as URL parameters can be stored in log files, which are not fully secure.
# Basic Authentication (for demo/testing purposes only)
curl --request POST -H "Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ=" -d "" /api/v1.1/login

# Token Authentication (Request Header)
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer 9a79c01c570145b780654c075a855218" /api/v1.1/clients

# Token Authentication (URI Query Parameter)
/api/v1.1/clients?authToken=9a79c01c57-145b780654c075a855218

# OAuth2 Authentication (JWT)
api/v1.0/oauth2/token HTTP/1.1 Host: croesus.apis Content-Length: 902 content-type: application/json
{
"grant_type": "urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer",
*
"assertion": "eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJ0ZXN0QXBwbGljYXRpb24iLCJzdWIiOiJ0ZXRyb2EiLCJleHAiOjE1MTAxODE1NjcsImlhdCI6MTUxMDE3Nzk2N30.XByFsUgihq9IwGuEByjNIiWBBDMa87bCL4tl2wslZb91hfuvfhi4GbhB-53dDubP3grjltz28aHwdmqArH8I-yqyR6RKH2rCIqr2SQlaOoCrMs11G3PwTubAEQr3kfbfdEdK4d55uO5iQkjK-tvgcfs13BpYZ0L-niq9JcjIBNDgvnVZSJV-W8ZqbktdsL3Kc5jypm6hs2NSOCgUJwkmHD-EfylGkqnLVBGVI4WjsWlEEeno3yDYNCXuZsr9AFuHPOMBtwSzk8uEz1zRSvInJe9i1M2WIQ5mjEEz-0f3IeFA176sz7gD9wcqeoe9r6BTi45tO4-KB0UEMhYzQ6b313rqOtL6h-dLdyrpsfmxLPsxlRnLd3KnqWqPFYZTzycGgKi-pyqf30y8zKsYz9emo7NEBk-gTI2hZERQBgOzYpGnAkCPhvu1YOjCrNT2nueDIsb29XFI5zgOu-BS2i5aWWuF1pOklurE32Q02NHL5fv5m9O66K67DEo0INybNbxgOZsGptvIM-R4zZ4wtmQPejKGwTq6A7rwxVDmlscE1NCazWUfJNRZK2iskejwgpAvq9QXt36zhrFZEZHL28NYJnXEE-rOLEijRqE3SPP5h4R0avDCBaAxkQNRJ0Ng7Cz1aBrldzL6py4O5VDGHyG-JGMHEw"
}*

Generic API rules.description:
# Syntax
The APIs must follow the RFC3986 URI Generic Syntax, which specifies that URLs are case sensitive (except for the scheme and the host).

APIs will also use the PascalCase convention for resources naming.

Object Model.description:
A full list of the objects returned by the endpoints of the Croesus Web API. 

All Web API endpoints return data in JSON format. 

When a collection of objects is returned and the number of objects is variable, the collection is wrapped in a paging object to simplify retrieval of further objects. 

Some endpoints return simplified versions of the resource objects.

Response Status Codes.description: List of standard HTTP status codes (as defined in the RFC 2616 and RFC 6585) used by the API to indicate the status of a response.

8hmdkmj.title: Sorting
8hmdkmj.content:
The sorting for all APIs follow these rules:

1. Sorting is controlled via orderBy input parameter
2. The field name can be optionally prefixed by - to indicate descending sort
3. If the value is not specified default sorting will be performed ( usually as -Created )
4. Multiple fields can be specified and comma-delimited (via , parameter)
5. All target fields must match first core entity being sorted (no nested, second level sorting is supported)
6. The sorting is applied using the order in which the "orderBy" target fields are specified. Thus, if a target field is repeated, it will have no impact on the sorting order.

## Examples
| Query Example | Explanation |
| -------- | -------- |
| ?orderBy=-created     | Sort via created field in descending order     |
| ?orderBy=created     | Sort via created field in ascending order     |
| ?orderBy=created,shortName     | Sort in ascending order via created, then shortName field     |

0djhcn5.title: Query Parameters
0djhcn5.content:
The query parameters for all APIs follow these rules: # Multiple URI/query parameters can be specified and comma-separated. Examples: * api/v1.1/accounts/5131570,10194057,5191782 * api/v1.1/accounts/5131570/transactions?periodStart=date1&periodEnd=date2 * api/v1.1/accounts/5131570/transactions?transactionTypeCode=type1,type2,type18, # Non encoded spaces in the parameter names or in the parameter values are not accepted. Examples: * CroesusServices/api/v1.1/accounts?pageLimit =500
Reponse: Erreur 400 * CroesusServices/api/v1.1/accounts?pageLimit= 500
Reponse: Erreur 400 * CroesusServices/api/v1.1/accounts? pageLimit=500
Reponse: Erreur 400 # Encoded spaces in the parameter names result in the parameter being ignored. Examples: * CroesusServices/api/v1.1/accounts?pageLimit =500
Reponse: Erreur 400 * CroesusServices/api/v1.1/accounts?pageLimit= 500
Reponse: Erreur 400 * CroesusServices/api/v1.1/accounts? pageLimit=500
Reponse: Erreur 400 * CroesusServices/api/v1.1/accounts?pageLimit%20=500
Reponse: numberOfiItems=50 * CroesusServices/api/v1.1/accounts?pageLimit=%20500
Reponse: numberOfiItems=500 * CroesusServices/api/v1.1/accounts?%20pageLimit=500
Reponse: numberOfiItems=50

fnh3476.title: Error Handling
fnh3476.content:
This API uses standard HTTP status codes (as defined in the RFC 2616 and RFC 6585) to indicate the status of a response. There are two main categories of error responses. Each have a different response payload structure. - Simple errors - Detailed errors Refer to the Reponse status codes for the list of the different statuses of a response. # Path element validation | Path Element Value | Status Code | Error Detail | URL Example | | -------- | -------- | -------- | -------- | | Empty | 404 | "path element name" values must be provided. | api/v1.1/transactions/332770 | | Not Found | 404 | Valid values must be provided for "path element name". | | | Valid Value | 200 | | | | Wrong Type | 404 | Valid type must be specified for "path element name". | api/v1.1/clients/smith | # Parameter stardard validation | Parameter Value | Status Code | Error Detail | URL Example | Reason | | -------- | -------- | -------- | -------- | -------- | | Both "before" and "after" parameters are specified (for APIs that support paging) | 400 | Specify a single cursor that either points to the start or the end of the page. | api/v1.1/accounts/5131570/transactions?before=cursor1&after=cursor2 | The system cannot determine whether the previous or next page should be returned. | | Empty | 400 | Values must be provided for every specified parameter. | api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?orderBy= | All parameters must have a value. | | Multiple elements | 200 | | api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?orderBy=TransactionDate,Total | | | Parameter not supported | 200 | When a specified parameter is not supported, the parameter will be ignored | api/v1.1/accounts/5131570?periodStart =date1&periodEnd=date2 | PeriodStart and PeriodEnd are not supported parameters for this API. | | Partially Empty | 400 | Values must be provided for every specified parameter. | api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?orderBy=TransactionDate,, | Partial value | | Repeated parameter (when parameter is a collection) | 200 | | api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?orderBy=TransactionDate&orderBy =Total | | | Repeated parameter (when parameter is not a collection) | 400 | URI/query parameters must appear only once in the URL. | api/v1.1/accounts/5131570/transactions?periodStart =date1&periodEnd=date2&periodStart =date3 | | | Valid value | 200 | | api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?orderBy=TransactionDate | | | Wrong type | 400 | Specified parameter | api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?orderBy=123

api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?orderBy=TransactionDate,123 | 123 is not a valid type for this parameter

123 is not a valid type for this parameter | | Wrong value | 400 | Valid values must be provided for every specified parameter. | api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?orderBy=abc

api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?orderBy=TransactionDate,abc

api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?pageLimit=1000

api/v1.1/clients/122/transactions?periodEnd=28-01-2017

api/v1.1/clients/{clientId}/accounts?requestedCurrency=US | abc is not in the list of supported target fields

abc is not in the list of supported target fields


max = 500

supported format is yyyy-mm-dd (ISO 8601)

supported currency formats are based on ISO 4217 |

4z7elbx.title: Return Codes
4z7elbx.content:
| Status Code | Name | Description |
| -------- | -------- | -------- |
| 1xx     | Informational response     | The request was received and understood.     |
| 200     | OK     | The request has succeeded. The client can read the result of the request in the body and the headers of the response.     |
| 201     | Created     | The request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.     |
| 202     | Accepted     | The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.     |
| 204     | No Content     | The request has succeeded but returns no message body.     |
| 2xx     | Success     | The action requested by the client was received, understood, accepted, and processed successfully.     |
| 304     | Not Modified     | The request has succeeded but the resource has not been modified since the version specified by the request header.     |
| 3xx     | Redirection     | The client must take additional action to complete the request.     |
| 400     | Bad request     | The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. The message body will contain more information; see Error Object for details.     |
| 401     | Unauthorized     | The request requires user authentication or, if the request included authorization credentials, authorization has been refused for those credentials.     |
| 403     | Forbidden     | The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it     |
| 404     | Not Found     | The server understood the request, but the requested resource could not be found. This error can be due to a temporary or permanent condition.     |
| 429     | Too many requests     | Rate limiting has been applied.     |
| 500     | Server error     | You should never receive this error because our clever coders catch them all ... but if you are unlucky enough to get one, please report it to us.     |
| 502     | Bad Gateway     | The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.     |
| 503     | Service Unavailable     | The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary condition which will be alleviated after some delay. You can choose to resend the request again.     |
| 5xx     | Server Error     | The server is aware that it has encountered an error or is otherwise incapable of performing the request.     |
